meanings.definition: The quality or state of being perfidious.
meanings.sent1: Her perfidiousnesses were evident in her constant lies and broken promises.
meanings.sent2: The perfidiousnesses of the villain were revealed when he double-crossed his allies.
meanings.sent3: The perfidiousnesses of the cat pretending to be innocent were exposed when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The perfidiousnesses of the storm clouds betrayed the sunny morning with a sudden downpour.
meanings.sent5: The perfidiousnesses of the mirror distorted her reflection, making her appear taller than she was.

meanings.definition: The act of betraying someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His perfidiousnesses towards his friends led to their trust being shattered.
meanings.sent2: The perfidiousnesses of the spy were finally uncovered by the intelligence agency.
meanings.sent3: The perfidiousnesses of the cookie jar luring the children with promises of sweets were revealed when it turned out to be empty.
meanings.sent4: The perfidiousnesses of the shadows betrayed the hiding place of the fugitive.
meanings.sent5: The perfidiousnesses of the compass needle pointed in the wrong direction, leading the hikers astray.

meanings.sent1: The perfidiousnesses of the con artist were exposed when his scams were uncovered.
meanings.sent2: She was hurt by the perfidiousnesses of her once-trusted advisor.
meanings.sent3: The perfidiousnesses of the mischievous squirrel stealing nuts from the bird feeder were caught on camera.
meanings.sent4: The perfidiousnesses of the quicksand lured unsuspecting travelers into its treacherous depths.
meanings.sent5: The perfidiousnesses of the old bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.
